ygData.subject: RE: Guise of the Deceiver question
ygData.msgSnippet: It does not seem to hide your religion. Nek guards hate Evile Sylly as much as Goodie Sylly and I think it is religion based. What s kinda weird is the Oger
ygData.messageBody:
It does not seem to hide your religion. Nek guards hate Evile Sylly as much
as Goodie Sylly and I think it is religion based. What's kinda weird is the
Oger merch just inside Ogg will sell to me as Evile Sylly but attacks me as
Goodie Sylly - but the Bouncers hate both of me.

Sylly - but which one? <muhaha>

-----Original Message-----
From: Mike Roach [mailto:mike.roach@...]
Sent: Monday, December 06, 1999 11:47 AM
To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
Subject: [eqbards] Guise of the Deceiver question

From: Mike Roach <mike.roach@...>

I was concerned that when in dark elf form I would be
attacked by the guards
and inhabitants of the good aligned cities I am normally
looked upon kindly
or warmly by, but this is not the case. Apparently you keep
all your
faction adjustments while under the dark elf illusion of the
guise.

My question is, is it useful in any way to by disguised as a
dark elf when
attempting to enter the evil aligned cities or is the mask's
illusion just
some nice eye-candy that gives you infravision?

-Faras
